verses.verse: Righteous<WH6662> art thou, O LORD<WH3068>, when I plead<WH7378> with thee: yet let me talk<WH1696> with thee of thy judgments<WH4941>: Wherefore doth the way<WH1870> of the wicked<WH7563> prosper<WH6743>? wherefore are all they happy<WH7951> that deal very<WH899> treacherously<WH898>? talk: or, reason the case with thee

Thou hast planted<WH5193> them, yea, they have taken root<WH8327>: they grow<WH3212>, yea, they bring forth<WH6213> fruit<WH6529>: thou art near<WH7138> in their mouth<WH6310>, and far from<WH7350> their reins<WH3629>. they grow: Heb. they go on

But thou, O LORD<WH3068>, knowest<WH3045> me: thou hast seen<WH7200> me, and tried<WH974> mine heart<WH3820> toward thee: pull them out<WH5423> like sheep<WH6629> for the slaughter<WH2878>, and prepare<WH6942> them for the day<WH3117> of slaughter<WH2028>. toward: Heb. with thee

How long shall the land<WH776> mourn<WH56>, and the herbs<WH6212> of every field<WH7704> wither<WH3001>, for the wickedness<WH7451> of them that dwell<WH3427> therein? the beasts<WH929> are consumed<WH5595>, and the birds<WH5775>; because they said<WH559>, He shall not see<WH7200> our last end<WH319>.

If thou hast run<WH7323> with the footmen<WH7273>, and they have wearied<WH3811> thee, then how canst thou contend<WH8474> with horses<WH5483>? and if in the land<WH776> of peace<WH7965>, wherein thou trustedst<WH982>, they wearied thee, then how wilt thou do<WH6213> in the swelling<WH1347> of Jordan<WH3383>?

For even thy brethren<WH251>, and the house<WH1004> of thy father<WH1>, even they have dealt treacherously<WH898> with thee; yea, they have called<WH7121> a multitude<WH4392> after<WH310> thee: believe<WH539> them not, though they speak<WH1696> fair words<WH2896> unto thee. they have called: or, they cried after thee fully fair: Heb. good things

I have forsaken<WH5800> mine house<WH1004>, I have left<WH5203> mine heritage<WH5159>; I have given<WH5414> the dearly beloved<WH3033> of my soul<WH5315> into the hand<WH3709> of her enemies<WH341>. the dearly: Heb. the love
Mine heritage<WH5159> is unto me as a lion<WH738> in the forest<WH3293>; it crieth out<WH5414> <WH6963> against me: therefore have I hated<WH8130> it. crieth: or, yelleth: Heb. giveth out his voice

Mine heritage<WH5159> is unto me as a speckled<WH6641> bird<WH5861>, the birds<WH5861> round about<WH5439> are against her; come<WH3212> ye, assemble<WH622> all the beasts<WH2416> of the field<WH7704>, come<WH857> to devour<WH402>. speckled: or, taloned come to: or, cause them to come to

Many<WH7227> pastors<WH7462> have destroyed<WH7843> my vineyard<WH3754>, they have trodden<WH947> my portion<WH2513> under foot<WH947>, they have made<WH5414> my pleasant<WH2532> portion<WH2513> a desolate<WH8077> wilderness<WH4057>. pleasant: Heb. portion of desire

They have made<WH7760> it desolate<WH8076>, and being desolate<WH8077> it mourneth<WH56> unto me; the whole land<WH776> is made desolate<WH8074>, because no man<WH376> layeth<WH7760> it to heart<WH3820>.

The spoilers<WH7703> are come<WH935> upon all high places<WH8205> through the wilderness<WH4057>: for the sword<WH2719> of the LORD<WH3068> shall devour<WH398> from the one end<WH7097> of the land<WH776> even to the other end<WH7097> of the land<WH776>: no flesh<WH1320> shall have peace<WH7965>.

They have sown<WH2232> wheat<WH2406>, but shall reap<WH7114> thorns<WH6975>: they have put themselves to pain<WH2470>, but shall not profit<WH3276>: and they shall be ashamed<WH954> of your revenues<WH8393> because of the fierce<WH2740> anger<WH639> of the LORD<WH3068>. they shall: or, ye shall

Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> against all mine evil<WH7451> neighbours<WH7934>, that touch<WH5060> the inheritance<WH5159> which I have caused my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478> to inherit<WH5157>; Behold, I will pluck them out<WH5428> of their land<WH127>, and pluck out<WH5428> the house<WH1004> of Judah<WH3063> from among<WH8432> them.

And it shall come to pass, after<WH310> that I have plucked them out<WH5428> I will return<WH7725>, and have compassion<WH7355> on them, and will bring them again<WH7725>, every man<WH376> to his heritage<WH5159>, and every man<WH376> to his land<WH776>.

And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently<WH3925> learn<WH3925> the ways<WH1870> of my people<WH5971>, to swear<WH7650> by my name<WH8034>, The LORD<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>; as they taught<WH3925> my people<WH5971> to swear<WH7650> by Baal<WH1168>; then shall they be built<WH1129> in the midst<WH8432> of my people<WH5971>.
But if they will not obey<WH8085>, I will utterly<WH5428> pluck up<WH5428> and destroy<WH6> that nation<WH1471>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>.
